title: Lebanon Says 8 Killed In Israel Strike Near Coastal City
content: Lebanon's health ministry said at least eight people were killed and 25 others wounded Sunday in an Israeli strike near the southern city of Sidon, where an AFP correspondent said a building was targeted.
summary: Lebanon's health ministry said at least eight people were killed and 25 others wounded Sunday in an Israeli strike near the southern city of Sidon, where an AFP correspondent said a building was targeted.

title: "My Father Was Killed": Netanyahu's Speech Interrupted By Protesters
content: Screaming relatives of Hamas attack victims interrupted a speech by Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Sunday during October 7 commemorations.
summary: Screaming relatives of Hamas attack victims interrupted a speech by Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Sunday during October 7 commemorations.

title: Over Rs 16 Lakh Raised For Family of Walmart Teen Found Dead In Oven
content: According to Halifax Regional Police, Ms Kaur was found dead inside an oven in the bakery section of a Halifax Walmart.

title: Truck Rams Into Bus Stop In Israel's Tel Aviv, Dozens Injured
content: A truck rammed into a bus stop north of the commercial hub Tel Aviv on Sunday, injuring dozens of people.
summary: A truck rammed into a bus stop north of the commercial hub Tel Aviv on Sunday, injuring dozens of people.

title: Iranian Officials Will Decide How To Respond To Israel: Ayatollah Khamenei
content: Khamenei said Iran's power should be demonstrated to Israel, adding that the way to do so should be "determined by the officials and that which is in the best interest of the people and the country should take place".
summary: Khamenei said Iran's power should be demonstrated to Israel, adding that the way to do so should be "determined by the officials and that which is in the best interest of the people and the country should take place".

title: Who Is Tommy Robinson, Anti-Islam, Far-Right Activist Arrested In UK
content: Tommy Robinson, whose real name is Stephen Yaxley-Lennon, is once again making headlines as a prominent figure in the UK's far-right movement.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Bridging The Rhine And The Ganges: Germany's Renewed 'Focus India'
content: Following nuclear testing in 1998, the Singh-Talbott talks provided the framework for shifting the Indo-US relationship from "estranged democracies" to "engaged democracies."
summary: Following nuclear testing in 1998, the Singh-Talbott talks provided the framework for shifting the Indo-US relationship from "estranged democracies" to "engaged democracies."

title: Putin Vows To "Respond" If Ukraine Hits Russia With Long-Range Weapons
content: Russia's President Vladimir Putin said Moscow will use "a range of responses" if the United States and its NATO allies allow Ukraine to use Western long-range weapons to strike inside Russia.
summary: Russia's President Vladimir Putin said Moscow will use "a range of responses" if the United States and its NATO allies allow Ukraine to use Western long-range weapons to strike inside Russia.

title: After Being Scolded By Boss, China Woman Stops Eating, Drinking And Moving
content: Li became catatonic and stopped eating, drinking, moving, or engaging in conversation.

title: Who Is Ashwin Ramaswami, Gen Z Democrat Up Against Donald Trump's Ally

title: Donald Trump Claims Sundar Pichai Called Him To Praise McDonald's Visit
content: Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump has claimed that Google CEO Sundar Pichai called him to compliment his recent visit to McDonald's.

title: Storm Trami Forces Million Philippines To Flee Homes, Death Count At 100
content: Rescuers in the Philippines were diving into a lake and scouring isolated villages on Sunday to locate dozens of missing people as the death count from Tropical Storm Trami hit 100.
summary: Rescuers in the Philippines were diving into a lake and scouring isolated villages on Sunday to locate dozens of missing people as the death count from Tropical Storm Trami hit 100.

title: 18-Year-Old Conquered World's 14 Highest Peaks. This Is His Next challenge
content: Nima Rinji Sherpa became the youngest climber to reach all 14 of the world’s tallest mountains, known as the “eight-thousanders.”
summary: Nima Rinji Sherpa became the youngest climber to reach all 14 of the world’s tallest mountains, known as the “eight-thousanders.”

title: Hezbollah Operative Behind 1992, 1994 Bombings In Argentina Identified
content: Long known to law enforcement as a shadowy figure operating under numerous aliases, Hussein Ahmad Karaki has evaded capture for decades, thanks in part to an extensive network and forged documentation allegedly supplied by Venezuela.

title: Opinion: Women-Led Businesses To Social Events, The Surprise That Is New Saudi
content: The Saudi Arabia with strict gender segregation, tough Islamic laws, and dress codes, no longer exists. The country's women are now truly in the drivers seat.

title: Litmus Test For Japan's Ishiba As Country Votes In General Elections
content: Japan voted on Sunday in its tightest election in years, with new Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba and his juggernaut Liberal Democratic Party facing potentially their worst result since 2009.
summary: Japan voted on Sunday in its tightest election in years, with new Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba and his juggernaut Liberal Democratic Party facing potentially their worst result since 2009.

title: 11-Year-Old Plays Dead To Escape Brother's Shooting Spree That Killed Five
content: Shot in her hand and neck as her brother went on a shooting spree, an 11-year-old girl in Washington escape death by playing dead as he inspected the bodies of their family members.
summary: Shot in her hand and neck as her brother went on a shooting spree, an 11-year-old girl in Washington escape death by playing dead as he inspected the bodies of their family members.

title: Israeli Airstrikes In Iran Hit Its Missile Fuel-Mixing Facilities: Report
content: Commercial satellite imagery showed that Israeli airstrikes hit buildings during an attack on Saturday that Iran used for mixing solid fuel for ballistic missiles.

title: Young Blue-Collar Workers: Key US Voters Who Will Decide Presidential Polls
content: Young blue-collar workers are being courted in a tight US presidential election that is forcing voters to weigh competing claims on immigration, inflation and other hot-button issues.

title: China Vows "Countermeasures" Over US Arms Sales To Taiwan
content: China will take "countermeasures" to defend its sovereignty and territorial integrity, the government said, lambasting a $2 billion arms sale package by the United States to Taiwan.
summary: China will take "countermeasures" to defend its sovereignty and territorial integrity, the government said, lambasting a $2 billion arms sale package by the United States to Taiwan.
